title: The Ephemeral → Structured Knowledge Problem
core_question: How do you transform chaotic, intuitive, context-rich mental fragments into structured, navigable knowledge without losing nuance?
context: NeuroGarden architecture, Quick capture pipelines, ADHD cognition.

title: The Entry Point Problem (The Zero-to-Start Paradox)
core_question: How do you begin when your brain cannot pick a starting point?
context: Blank-page paralysis, Flow Mode design, Initiation struggles.

title: The Meaningful Connection Mapping Problem
core_question: Given a set of ideas, how do you reveal the actual meaningful relationships between them?
context: Flow Mode, Knowledge graphs, Cross-domain analogies.

title: The Cognitive Schema Visibility Problem
core_question: How do you expose the hidden mental models people use to understand reality?

title: The Agentic External Brain Problem
core_question: How do you design an AI system that acts like an extension of your mind, not a tool you command?

title: The Motivation & Activation Physics Problem
core_question: What are the variables and forces that determine whether you can activate into a task?

title: The Automation Architecture Problem
core_question: How do you design a system of systems that stays understandable, stable, and adaptive?
context: Homelab, AI automation, Infrastructure as cognition.

title: The “Human Map” Unification Problem
core_question: Is there a universal map of how a person works—cognitively, emotionally, motivationally—that can be assessed, visualized, and used?

title: The Parent–Child Engagement Optimization Problem
core_question: How do you design playful, structured encounters with your kids that create meaning, learning, and bonding?

title: The “Start Anywhere” Interaction Design Problem
core_question: How do you build interfaces that let someone start from whatever fragment they have and immediately feel momentum?
context: Flow Mode redesign, UX for nonlinear thinkers.
